question: Format answer for: Regarding patient 'CII-3' from family 'Family C': What is the genomic-level notation for the first mutation?
context:
The genomic-level notation for the mutation in patient 'CII-3' from family 'Family C' is c.1858G>A.

This is derived from:
1.  Page 3, FIG. 1 shows patient CII-3 in family C. The legend states that asterisked individuals were analyzed for the p.D620N mutation.
2.  Page 3, TABLE 1 confirms patient CII-3 carries the "VPS35 p.D620N" mutation with an "A/G" genotype, indicating heterozygosity.
3.  Page 2, under "Genetic Analysis", states: "...genotyped for c.1858G>A (p.D620N) mutation...".
4.  Page 2, left column, third paragraph, states: "Mutation of c.1858G>A (p.D620N) was identified...".
5.  Page 3, in the paragraph below Figure 1, it states: "Patients carrying the p.D620N mutation did not have any other variants in all exons of VPS35." This implies this is the first (and only mentioned) mutation for this patient.
